intro: Streptocarpus monophyllus, commonly known as the single-leaf streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to its arid environment. Its flowers are borne on short stems and are often clustered together, creating a dense inflorescence. Streptocarpus monophyllus is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
